name: NPR
text:
RT @WorldCafe: The two country-leaning singer-songwriters on their time in Nashville, addressing the darkness of life while staying in the light and the difficulties of thinking forward in the South. @beccamancari
@SGGoodmanKY https://t.co/exp9y836AJ

name: NPR
text:
Dr. Deborah Birx says the CDC is working on a new way to track COVID-19 hospitalizations — just a month after the Trump administration mandated that hospitals sidestep the CDC in collecting such data.
https://t.co/WTVjeaX8P8

name: NPR
text:
It's the final night of the #DemConvention. 

Joe Biden is set to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for president and will take center stage to lay out his vision for America.

Join us for live video and analysis.
https://t.co/yKej0YASKl

name: NPR
text:
Andrew Yang: “I have gotten to know both Joe and Kamala on the trail over the past year ... They understand the problems we face. They are parents and patriots who want the best for our country." #DemConvention
https://t.co/xRDbSf96ql

name: NPR
text:
Introducing a tribute to the late civil rights icon John Lewis, Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms says: “The baton has now been passed to each of us.” 

“We must register, and we must vote.” #DemConvention https://t.co/oHT13Lr7mo

name: NPR
text:
Democrats once again honored Rep. John Lewis, the late civil rights icon, who died last month. “From day one, John Lewis was a role model in the Congress,” said House Speaker Nancy Pelosi in a tribute video. #DemConvention
https://t.co/0VbnxzI7Y4

name: NPR
text:
Julia Louis-Dreyfus quipped that she can’t wait to see the vice presidential debate featuring Kamala Harris and “Mica Pints … or is it Paints?” she said at the DNC, taking aim at Republicans who can't seem to pronounce Kamala Harris' name correctly.
https://t.co/QZbac55Y2R

name: NPR
text:
Rep. Deb Haaland is a 35th generation New Mexican and one of the first Native Americans elected to Congress.

“Whether we vote and how we vote will determine if our nation’s promise of social, racial and environmental justice will outlast us," she says.
https://t.co/h2sjMF9Dvh
